page.title: 02HOW SHAPINSAY GOT ITS NAME
page.content: Many years ago, it was argued how {Shapinsay}got its name. It could have meant{Sheep valley}because the{Saxons thought "ay" meant valley, and "shap" meant sheep. It also could have meant {Sheep Island}because in{Norse}"shap" meant sheep and "ay" meant island. Both explanations could be right, because we know that the{Saxons}as well as the{Vikings}have inhabited this island. At the present time,{Shapinsay}has only one farm which is purely a sheep farm, but the nick-name of "Shapinsay Sheep" still sticks to the islanders !
